etymologies: early 18th century: modern Latin, diminutive of Latin frenum ‘bridle’

definitions: a small fold or ridge of tissue that supports or checks the motion of the part to which it is attached, in particular a fold of skin beneath the tongue, or between the lip and the gum.
shortDefinitions: small fold or ridge of tissue that supports or checks motion of part to which it is attached

definitions: (in some moths and butterflies) a bristle or row of bristles on the edge of the hind wing that keeps it in contact with the forewing.
shortDefinitions: (in some moths and butterflies) bristle or row of bristles on edge of hind wing that keeps it in contact with forewing
